content: Have you checked what accounts you have already added in account settings? Just because an account does not work, it does not prevent it being added as it is always easier to start with what is not working that keep doing the same thing over and over and expecting a different result.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Are you talking about the primary password? https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password

The article includes information on how to reset that.

Are you talking about your account passwords? Those are stored, but not set by Thunderbird. See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/password-manager-remember-delete-change-tb

If you have issues with your account password, I suggest you contact your mail provider.

If Thunderbird has suddenly started asking for a password after working without a request for a long time, the problem is probably your antivirus program and not Thunderbird at all. The following diagnostic process will help in identify that;

  • Does Thunderbird work as expected in Thunderbird troubleshooting mode?
  • Does Thunderbird work as expected with your OS started in safe mode with Networking. Instructions for each operating system: Windows 10/11, Windows 8, Windows 7, OSX
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Are you seeking support? I really don't know, but I do not think so.

If you are trying to offer feedback, you might want to use the link on the Thunderbird help menu, or https://connect.mozilla.org (Same thing)

This is a peer support forum, and since the Thunderbird team put a feedback link on the help menu, the number of folk coming here to offer feedback to their fellow Thunderbird users has grown not reduced to Zero as it should have.

I am not sure what you mean by " I used to use most of your products" Mzla and the Thunderbird council has but one product. Thunderbird. They are not linked to the Mozilla company that makes Firefox and distributes other products listed here. https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/products/

Thunderbird is almost 20 having reached Version 1 release on 7th December 2004 and in most of the decade after Mozilla cut it free in 2012 simply maintaining the product in a state where the source code would build was about all the volunteers that were doing the development could mange. In the past few years donations have allowed a growing number of developers to be hired to try and pay down some of the technical debt that accrued in the lost years. I have many personal misgivings about the direction the project is now taking, but it is at last moving. My misgivings are about the team concentrating on the user interface design in their migration away for XUL. Much of the back end is in the process of being rewritten in JavaScript. Never been a fast way to execute anything in my experience, but it fits with their desire to use "web technologies" on the desktop. It is also probably no slower that using Microsoft managed code which most windows store applications use now.

Profile migration is, as you have said, an utter mess and I really think it will get worse long before it gets better. The profile import tools makes no attempt to migrate passwords. Personally I consider moving them one of the important bits. I don't know them and looking up some 20 passwords is not what I consider migration. Setting up accounts is not hard, remembering passwords. That is hard.

The profile migration code also makes no attempt to migrate mail in the IMAP mail folders. The argument is that synchronization will soon replace any missing mail.

The Migration tool is limited to 2Gb profiles. Most folk have more than 2Gb if mail these days so a profile migration tool that can not cope with a more common 10 or 20 Gb profile is really not all that useful. Mine is more than 40Gb and I have exactly no use at all of these new but fatally broken tools which assume I have a mail store akin to what I had when the server allowed my 5Mb of storage.

Then you get told just copy the profile. It sure used to work, and work well if the copy included the folder with profiles.ini in it and everything under it. But someone at Mozilla built a profile per install "feature" that largely means that now it will basically only work like it used to if both the version of Thunderbird you are leaving and the one you are going to are the exact same version, and who updates their software on the machine they are abandoning immediately before they turn it off for the last time.

Soon to be released is a Firefox like synchronization Thunderbird Sync, but what is not clear is exactly what that will Sync. As they are using Mozilla sync servers, I would assume the amount of data is strictly limited. So a multi gigabyte profile folder will probably not be what we get. But I hear talk of account settings and address books. I guess the address book sync will relieve them of the urgent need to fix the profile per install which periodically just decides you need a new profile when Thunderbird updates.

With all that going on, it is far easier to just allow the new version to create a new profile and then copy the files from the old profile folders into the new one, overwriting the existing files in the new profile. No fighting the various "features" and it always works. That is if you copied all the files and sub folders in the profile folder (something that appears to exceed the abilities of many windows users.) and Thunderbird was not running while you replaced the files it uses to actually present your mail.

I do encourage you to use the feedback tool. You might also want to participate in some of the User experience discussions at topicbox. https://thunderbird.topicbox.com/groups/ux

You and I sharing our respective issues here does nothing to actually draw the attention of the developers.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: This is not about Thunderbird, but the for the generic server settings applicable to any email client. What you should clarify as well is whether settings for Breezeline are now applicable, or whether any specific settings for atlanticbb.net accounts are required.
creator: christ1

content:
See if you can access an @atlanticbb.net account with their recommended settings:

incoming IMAP server: mail.breezeline.net on 993, SSL/TLS, normal password, User Name = email address

outgoing SMTP server: mail.breezeline.net on 465, SSL/TLS, normal password, User Name = email address

https://www.breezeline.com/support/account/email-account/how-do-i-set-up-my-email

creator: who7157

content:
Looks to me like you're using Avira antivirus. To test if it's interfering with the connection (a common AV issue), either remove (not disable) it or run Windows in safe mode.

Changing the number of connections rarely fixes this, unless you have another device like a mobile phone that is simultaneously making multiple connections to the same account.
creator: sfhowes

content: Thanks....
creator: who7157

content:
Do you have an apple device specifically as they cause the most issues by using all available connections or any other devices that also access that mail account.

You should also ask you mail provider how many IMAP connections they actually allow on their server concurrently. Most allow a lot more than you would think, like in the 10 to 15 range, other limit you so tightly you would think we were all still using dialup modems.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Hello, I just got off the phone with atlanticbb.net/breezeline.net support. He told me there is no limit on how many devices can connect to their system. No apple devices. I checked, Avira antivirus is not interfering with connection. Support responded that it must be Thunderbird cause it's not on their end. Before calling However, I played around with T-Bird for a while until I did get some emails coming in many all at once & they never filtered through the email program like they should. They were all in the inbox at once. Now I will have to spend hours filtering out the emails again. I did get the error code once again about "imap" setting too many connections..Not sure what I'm going do here I may just end T-Bird & try another email desktop program. I truly enjoyed using it for many years now, but just too many issues with it. Many of the emails never did filter correctly you found several about a week later in another email box.

Thanks to all for the T-Bird advice given. I also made several contributions in the past.

David

content:
I have seen that in the past when the authentication details (user name and password, or lack of them result in you sending mail when not logged in. The server then considers one too many as you are not logged it.

Check the outgoing server (SMTP setting for the account and ensure they are correct. You make no mention of what mail provider, so I can not look them up for you, but they should be published on their web site.

Note there are very very few SMTP servers that do not require authentication. So a Setting on None is almost certain to by wrong.

creator: ephemeris.lappis

content: Thunderbird's native storage format is the RD variant of MBOX. I think Google use exactly the same variant, but I am not 100% on that. Apple mail used to also use it, and with the application of a zip program the native mbox files can still be extracted from when Apple mail exports and imorted the same way.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Hello Good news ! This means that's a really simple way to import or export messages between GMail and Thunderbird. Exporting from GMail using labels selections allows to extract limited size MBOX files that can easily be placed in on or more TB profiles folders. I'm sure that's is going to help more people too. Thanks a lot for your explanation. Regards.

content: So, from your post, you are not sending messages, but attempting to upload exist messages to an IMAP account? If so, IMAP is not designed to do that well, although can be done in small increments.

This is because I will need to close it down and am moving to a new system but do not want to loose all of my existing emails. There will be an overlap period whilst I sort this out. It is not a huge number of emails. So why did it just stop part way through? Also why are changes in file structure etc not showing. I think I was maybe misled as to what this system using Imap was suitable for?
creator: clerk11

content: IMAP is an excellent email system, keeping messages on server, yet allowing messages to be sync'd on PC for offline use. If you create a file structure with multiple folders, it will use the structure.

content: You probably exceeded your providers daily download limit, so it stopped. Did you check on what limiyts your provider had with regard to downloads, uploads bandwidth etc. Some have hourly limits, daily limits and yet others monthly or some combination of all of them in the form of a responsible use policy) Your impatience has probably made the situation much worse, as generally those limits expire after 24 hours You however keep removing the software and trying again. Probably hitting the same limit and deferring any mail for another 24 hours.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Your mail is refused by Spectrum because "This email account has limited access to send emails based on suspicious activity. Blocks will expire based on the nature of the activity. If you’re a Spectrum customer, contact us to remove the block."

The contact us link goes to https://www.spectrum.net/contact-us

Fundamentally your provider has limited you account because they think you are sending spam. That is why it will resolve itself in 24 to 48 hours. The computer system probably automatically limit and removes the limitation based on time since last limit imposed.

Interesting they encourage you to contact them to have the block removed and when you do they say it will fix itself in a day or two.

The IP address mentioned 216.131.75.10 however appears to be issued to strong technologies. https://ipinfo.io/216.131.75.10 If you are sending from a non spectrum IP address, work perhaps, that might be a big part in their decision your activity is suspicious. But I think you just need to ask on the contact us line and get them to fully explain it to you, as really I can research some stuff, but I am not privy to the use policies at Spectrum. Only the can explain what their customer policies are.
creator: MattAuSupport
